definitions.definition: to show something in a public place for people to enjoy or to give them information

examples.text: They will be exhibiting their new designs at the trade fairs.
Only one painting was exhibited in the artist's lifetime.
He longed for the chance to exhibit his work publicly.
She exhibits regularly in local art galleries.

definitions.definition: to show clearly that you have or feel a particular quality, ability, feeling or symptom

examples.text: The patient exhibited signs of fatigue and memory loss.
The three novels exhibit a growing confidence in the author's use of language.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (in the sense ‘submit for consideration’, also ‘present a document as evidence in court’): from Latin exhibit- ‘held out’, from the verb exhibere, from ex- ‘out’ + habere ‘hold’.
